results.title: Walker
results.creator_credit: Walker Films Limited, ICINE, Angel Flores Marini, Lorenzo O'Brien and Alex Cox
results.brief_description: William Walker, and his belief in manifest destiny - the American practice of continental expansion - are at the core of Alex Cox’s satire of a 19th century American legend. A gang of incompetent American troops, led by Walker, head south from San Francisco to liberate Nicaragua from its oppressive president. Corneilius Vanderbuilt, a tycoon millionaire, funds the mission, but feels Walker’s naive, albeit charismatic, character will ensure stability in the Central American state controlling the Pacific-Atlantic trade. Walker embodies the religious and puritanical traits of manifest destiny and is filled with notions of self-importance and historical greatness. Walker is oblivious to the barbarity of his own troops and their thirst for sex and violence; ironically the behaviour of his men epitomizes the false image that Walker holds of the savages. When Nicaragua is won Walker places a patriot as President; he appoints himself General of the armed forces and, in an act that summarizes the history of the South America, stages a coup against his own government. Dreamlike scenes of slow-motion bloody violence are complimented by Ed Harris’ ability to shift between dry deadpan humour and frenzied evangelical prophesising. Melding past and future images of soldiers, Cox presents a powerful non-linear twist on history, suggesting a potent link between manifest destiny and Reaganism. Cast includes Richard Masur, Rene Assa, Rene Auberjonois, Peter Boyle.

results.title: Walkaway prices
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Jack Zalkalns
results.brief_description: A dramatized re-enactment of an adolescent boy’s increasing involvement in petty theft and vandalism due to the peer pressure exerted on him by two other boys. His fears of being detected are eventually borne out when two detectives appear at the school and ask to see him. Cast includes: Robert Clarkson, Dam Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Walkabout: the Chauvel's legendary journey...
results.brief_description: Originally produced for British television in 1958 this thirteen part series follows internationally renowned Australian filmmakers Charles Chauvel and Elsa Chauvel on a 3,000 mile journey through Australia. Setting off from Sydney they travel across the Great Dividing Range, heading westward to the outback “dead heart” of Australia through Central Australia and on to the Northern Territory. They look at the outback with all its “bewildering contradictions” - deserts, pasturelands, wide grasslands, opal country, mountain ranges and rivers - join a cattle muster, catch brumbies, observe unique wildlife and visit Aboriginal communities. The series is a time capsule of Australian outback life in the middle of the twentieth century reflecting the attitudes held by white Australians towards Aboriginal peoples and the land at the time. Narrated by Elsa and Charles Chauvel.

results.title: Walkabout
results.creator_credit: Max L. Raab - Si Litvinoff Films, Si Litvinoff and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister and her young brother left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They’re rescued by a young Aboriginal man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Max L. Raab - Si Litvinoff Films, Si Litvinoff and Nicolas Roeg
results.description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister (Jenny Agutter) and her young brother (Lucien John) left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They are rescued by a young Aboriginal man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood. During their journey Gulpilil courts the young woman, though in her incomprehension she rejects his advances. The vision of paradise lost presented with an often surreal intensity is that of a European outsider, who sees white history as invasive and deeply destructive. Also stars John Meillon, Robert McDara, Pete Carver, John Illingsworth, Hilary Bamberger, Barry Donnelly, Noelene Brown and Carlo Machini. Screenplay by Edward Bond, based on the novel by James Vance Marshall. Edited by Antony Gibbs and Alan Pattillo. Music composed and conducted by John Barry.

results.title: Walk the talk
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Jan Chapman and Shirley Barrett
results.brief_description: Shirley Barrett displayed a penchant for black comedy with her successful debut feature “Love serenade”. “Walk the talk”, her second feature, is a darkly comic tale about several deluded individuals trying to govern unreachable dreams of stardom. Joey is a con man fresh out of prison after serving a stint for selling fake cellulite cream. His girlfriend is Bonita, confined to a wheelchair, and awaiting a one million dollar compensation payout. Joey’s latest scheme on his road to glory is to sell the minimal talents of Nikki, a bad-tempered singer and dancer. Joey convinces Bonita to bankroll his idea and he creates a plan that will make both him and Nikki rich and famous. The cultural milieu unique to Surfers Paradise in Queensland is milked for laughs - Nikki’s father mocks her for being a showbiz failure, where as he has made it as an entertainer of pensioners between their rounds of bingo. When Joey’s grand scheme to make Nikki a star goes awry, he makes the decision that no act is unworthy if it results in fame, or at the very least infamy, for the pair.

results.title: Walk me to the water
results.creator_credit: St Peter's Hospice and John Seakwood
results.brief_description: An intimate portrayal of the experiences of three terminally ill cancer patients being cared for at home. By allowing these patients and those closest to them to tell their own stories, the film conveys a broad range of circumstances, amotions, and insights including the fear and confusion felt by those coping with terminal illness and the strengthening of family bonds that can accompany this distress.

results.title: Walk into wilderness
results.creator_credit: Impala Films, Spectangee Productions and Richard Bennett
results.brief_description: Three young people (Tony Evans, Stewart Graham and Karen Alexander) set out to climb Federation Peak, a rarely climbed mountain in the rugged South West region of Tasmania. The difficulties they encounter en route include bad weather and the dangerous nature of the terrain. After a few days climbing, the trio finally achieve their goal and reach the summit of Federation Peak.
